title: Bob Ayres (rugby league)
text:
Robert Herbert Ayres (11 January 1914 – July 1993) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, <a href="British%20Empire%20XIII%20rugby%20league%20team">British Empire</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>, as a , or , i.e. 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Bob Ayres was born in <a href="Barrow-in-Furness">Barrow-in-Furness</a>, Lancashire, England, and he died aged 79 in Lancashire.
Playing career.
International honours.
Bob Ayres represented <a href="British%20Empire%20XIII%20rugby%20league%20team">British Empire</a> while at Barrow in 1937 against France, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Barrow in 1938 against Wales, and France, and in 1945 against Wales.
County honours.
Bob Ayres won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>(s) for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a> while at Barrow.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Bob Ayres played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>'s 4–7 defeat by <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in the <a href="1938%20Challenge%20Cup">1938 Challenge Cup</a> Ffondon on Saturday 7 May 1938.
County Cup Final appearances.
Bob Ayres played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>'s 4–8 defeat by <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1937%20Lancashire%20Cup">1937 Lancashire County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1937%E2%80%9338%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1937–38 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 23 October 1937.
Testimonial match.
Bob Ayres' <a href="Testimonial%20match">Testimonial match</a>es at <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> were shared with <a href="Val%20Cumberbatch">Val Cumberbatch</a>, <a href="John%20Higgin">John Higgin</a>, <a href="William%20Little%20%28rugby%20league%20born%20circa-1910%29">William Little</a> and <a href="Dan%20McKeating">Dan McKeating</a>, and took place against <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> on Saturday 27 April 1946, and against <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> on Saturday 27 January 1947.
Contemporaneous article extract.
"The man who always comes up smiling, Club captain during the war years. A product of local football, signed in 1933. Has few equals as a . International and County player."
